questions.text: What does HTML stand for?
Which HTML tag is used to define the largest heading?
Which tag is used for inserting a line break?
Which attribute specifies an alternative text for an image?
Which HTML tag is used to display a numbered list?
Which HTML element is used to define a paragraph?
Which of the following is the correct way to link an external stylesheet?
Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which of the following HTML elements is not a valid form control?
What is the default file extension for HTML files?
What does CSS stand for?
Which property is used to change the background color?
Which property is used to change the text color of an element?
How do you select an element with the class 'button' in CSS?
Which CSS property is used to change the font of an element?
What is the default position value for an HTML element?
Which property is used to create space between the element's content and its border?
Which CSS property is used to make text bold?
Which CSS property is used to control the stacking order of elements?
Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the root element?
Which attribute is used to define inline CSS styles?
Which HTML5 element is used to define navigation links?
What is the purpose of the `<figure>` and `<figcaption>` elements in HTML5?
options: To group media content like images with captions
questions.correctAnswer: To group media content like images with captions

questions.text: Which CSS property is used to create a flexible layout?
What does the `z-index` property control?
Which CSS property is used to create animations?
Which pseudo-class is used to style an element when it has keyboard focus?
What is the difference between `relative` and `absolute` positioning in CSS?
options: Relative positions an element based on the viewport, while absolute positions it relative to its closest positioned ancestor.
Relative positions an element relative to its normal position, while absolute positions it based on the viewport.
Relative and absolute are the same in CSS.
Relative positions an element based on the viewport, while absolute positions it relative to its sibling elements.
questions.correctAnswer: Relative positions an element relative to its normal position, while absolute positions it based on the viewport.

questions.text: Which CSS function is used to rotate an element?
What does the `media` attribute in a `<link>` tag specify?
options: The type of content the link references
The type of file being linked
The device or condition the stylesheet is applied to
The title of the linked document
questions.correctAnswer: The device or condition the stylesheet is applied to

questions.text: What is the difference between `em` and `rem` units in CSS?
options: `em` is relative to the font size of its parent, while `rem` is relative to the font size of the root element.
`em` is absolute, while `rem` is relative to its parent element.
`em` is used for margins, while `rem` is used for font sizes.
`em` is relative to the viewport, while `rem` is relative to its container.
questions.correctAnswer: `em` is relative to the font size of its parent, while `rem` is relative to the font size of the root element.
